areaSection: Javea, nestled on the northern Costa Blanca in the province of Alicante, is a picturesque coastal town renowned for its dramatic rocky coves, pristine beaches, and authentic Mediterranean character. Situated approximately 100km north of Alicante city, Javea benefits from a privileged location between Valencia and the southern Costa Blanca regions. The town's geography features a stunning coastline with over 25km of beaches and hidden coves, backed by the Sierra de Bernia mountain range. Javea enjoys over 300 days of annual sunshine, with mild winters and warm, dry summers creating an idyllic climate for year-round leisure. The unique blend of Spanish tradition and cosmopolitan amenities has transformed Javea into a preferred destination for European holiday home buyers seeking authentic Mediterranean living without sacrificing modern conveniences.
lifestyleSection: Life in Javea revolves around the Mediterranean rhythm—leisurely beach mornings, afternoon tapas at waterfront cafés, and evening paseos through charming old town streets. The expat community is exceptionally welcoming, with large populations of British, German, and Dutch residents ensuring excellent English-language services and international perspectives throughout daily life. Fresh produce markets operate year-round, supermarkets like Mercadona and Consum stock familiar international products, and the British Corner Shop caters to those missing home comforts. Beach culture dominates summers, with the family-friendly Arenal beach earning Blue Flag status, while La Grava and the dramatic Portitxol coves offer more intimate settings. Healthcare access is straightforward with English-speaking doctors abundant and Hospital de Dénia just 15 minutes away. Golf enthusiasts enjoy the local 9-hole Jávea Golf Club plus championship courses at La Sella and Oliva Nova. The weekly farmers market, countless restaurants spanning Spanish to international cuisines, and the ferry connection to Ibiza from nearby Dénia keep life engaging and connected.

At €320,000, this property is priced 30% below comparable Mallorca properties, delivering exceptional value on the Costa Blanca. The combination of affordable entry pricing, growth potential, and income-generating capacity makes this an attractive proposition for holiday home investors seeking Mediterranean exposure without excessive capital outlay.

The Spanish healthcare system ranks among Europe's finest, and private insurance is affordable and straightforward to arrange. From routine check-ups to specialist care, residents enjoy peace of mind knowing quality medical services are readily accessible.

shopping.text: Shopping in Javea caters to both local Spanish shopping culture and international resident needs. transport.text: Transportation around Javea and the Costa Blanca is straightforward and affordable. Driving is the preferred option for day trips and exploring the region, with excellent roads and affordable fuel. Parking is readily available throughout town, and traffic congestion is minimal compared to larger Spanish cities.
